subject: Science
title: Our Earliest Ancestors
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Our Earliest Ancestors.

hook.text: Six million years ago, our ancestors looked nothing like us. They were small and ape-like.

buildup.text: The human and chimpanzee lineages split about 6 to 7 million years ago in Africa.

discovery.text: Australopithecus walked upright but had a small brain â€” about a third the size of ours.

twist.text: Walking upright freed our hands â€” which eventually let us make tools and carry food.

climax.text: Lucy, a 3.2-million-year-old skeleton, proved bipedalism came long before big brains.

punchline.text: We walked upright first. Big brains came millions of years later.
